page.title: 12ST. MARTIN'S CHURCH HOUGHTON
page.content: This 13th. century church stands in the park of Houghton Hall.Its original village was moved outside the park gates when Sir Robert Walpole was building the Hall in 1729 The church has long associations with the Walpole family.It is famous for the nine hatchments, painted wooden heraldic shields,hanging in it.There is some heraldic stained glass, nine Walpole memorial slabs, and a fine effigy of a Prior of Coxford dated 13O7.In 1726 the tower was built and the rare weeping nave restored.The North aisle is late perpendicular period.The chancel arch and the nave arcades belong to the earlier decorated period.Four grand box pews were made in 1855 for prominent local families. The church now belongs to a group of parishes,services are held at intervals and on special occassions.
